qas.question: Where has the official home of the Scottish Parliament been since 2004?
Who designed the Scottish Parliament building?
What nationality is the architect Enric Miralles?
What shape are some of the buildings in the Parliament complex?
Who opened the new Parliament building on October 9, 2004?
Since 1904, the home of Scottish Parliament has been where?
The down turned boat skylights are located in what lobby?
Queen Elizabeth I opened the new Scottish Parliament Building on what date?
French architect Enric Miralles helped design what building?

context: Since September 2004, the official home of the Scottish Parliament has been a new <a0_0><a0_1><b6_0><b9_0>Scottish Parliament Building<b9_0/><b6_0/><a0_1/><a0_0/>, in the Holyrood area of <a0_2><b5_0>Edinburgh<b5_0/><a0_2/>. The Scottish Parliament building was designed by <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2>Spanish<a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> architect <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2>Enric Miralles<a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> in partnership with local Edinburgh Architecture firm RMJM which was led by Design Principal Tony Kettle. Some of the principal features of the complex include <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2>leaf-shaped<a3_1/><a3_0/> buildings<a3_2/>, a grass-roofed branch merging into adjacent parkland and gabion walls formed from the stones of previous buildings. Throughout the building there are many repeated motifs, such as shapes based on Raeburn's Skating Minister. Crow-stepped gables and the upturned boat skylights of the <b7_0>Garden<b7_0/> Lobby, complete the unique architecture. <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2>Queen Elizabeth II<a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> opened the new building on <b8_0>9 October 2004<b8_0/>.
